title: conferred on me by section 42 of the Public Service Pay and Pensions Act
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Public Service Pay and Pensions
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Public Service Pay and Pensions 

Act 2017 (Section 42) (Payments to General Practitioners) (Amendment) 
Regulations 2020.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited public service pay pension act 2017 (section 42) (payments general practitioners) (amendment) regulation 2020

title: conferred on me by section 42 of the Public Service Pay and Pensions Act
heading: 2. The Public Service Pay and Pensions Act 2017 (Section 42) (Payments
text_raw:
2. The Public Service Pay and Pensions Act 2017 (Section 42) (Payments 
to General Practitioners) Regulations 2019 (S.I. No. 692 of 2019) are amended 
– 

(1) by the insertion of the following definitions in Regulation 3: 

“ ‘Covid-19’ means a disease caused by infection with the virus 
SARS-CoV-2 and specified as an infectious disease in accordance 
with Regulation 6 of, and the Schedule to, the Infectious Diseases 
Regulations 1981 (S.I. No. 390 of 1981) or any variant of the disease 
so specified as an infectious disease in those Regulations; 

‘data return’ means the submission by a service provider to the Health 
Service Executive of information in accordance with the Agreement 
following a Modified Structured Chronic Disease 
of 2019 
Management Review; 

‘Modified Structured Chronic Disease Management Programme’ 
means the Chronic Disease Management Programme modified in 
response to the threat to public health posed by the spread of Covid-19 
consisting of a Modified Structured Chronic Disease Management 
Review; 

‘Modified Structured Chronic Disease Management Review’ means a 
remote review consultation or a structured in-surgery review or both; 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 21st August, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [311] 3 

‘Practice Nurse Grant’ means the fee payable to a service provider in 
respect of the services of a practice nurse rendered as part of the 
Modified Structured Chronic Disease Management Review; 

‘remote review consultation’ means a consultation between a service 
provider and a patient aged 70 years or over who has a diagnosis of 
one or more of the conditions mentioned in the Modified Structured 
Chronic Disease Management Programme that is carried out other 
than in person, whether by telephone or other electronic means, for the 
purposes of conducting a clinical review in respect of that patient’s 
condition rendered under and in accordance with the General Medical 
Services Scheme; 

‘structured in-surgery review’ means a consultation between a service 
provider and a patient aged 70 years or over who has a diagnosis of 
one or more of the conditions mentioned in the Modified Structured 
Chronic Disease Management Programme that is carried out at a 
general practitioner’s surgery, for the purposes of conducting a full 
chronic disease review, including phlebotomy, in respect of that 
patient, rendered under and in accordance with the General Medical 
Services Scheme;”, 

(2) by the insertion of the following Regulation after Regulation (5): 

“5A. Notwithstanding Regulation 5, the amount of the payment 
specified in column (3) of Schedule 2, Part A opposite reference 
numbers 1, 2 or 3 in column (1) shall not apply as the payment to be 
made to a service provider in respect of the particular service specified 
in column (2) of Part A of that Schedule if the payment specified in 
column (3) of Schedule 2, Part A opposite reference numbers 4, 5 or 6 
in column (1) shall apply.”, and 

(3) by the substitution of the following Schedule for Schedule 2: 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [311] 

“SCHEDULE 2 

PART A 

Services rendered under the General Medical Services Scheme – Agreement 
of 2019 – payments in respect of delivery of Modified Structured Chronic 
Disease Management Programme 

Reference 

Number 

(1) 

Description 

(2) 

Amount 

(Total) 

(3)

title: conferred on me by section 42 of the Public Service Pay and Pensions Act
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

These Regulations shall apply to payments in respect of the delivery of the 
Modified Structured Chronic Disease Management Programme by a general 
practitioner to or on behalf of the Health Service Executive under and in 
accordance with the terms of the General Medical Services Scheme Agreement of 2019. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 8 [311]
